content.content: Kurono is intended to be used by schools with your class. Your teacher will select the level for the class and you will all complete the challenges together.

leftColumn.leftColumn:
Kurono is an online multiplayer game that allows players to program their avatars to respond to the environment around them.

By creating a function that will be repeatedly evaluated by the game, a player must instruct their avatar to perform actions such as search and collect objects.

rightColumn.rightColumn:
Players should have some Python experience already. There is a cheat sheet for more information on the pre–built functions that can be used in the
game.

leftColumn.leftColumn:
**To start using the game:**

1. Open your web browser and go to: [www.codeforlife.education](https://www.codeforlife.education) *[Fig 1]*

2. [Log in](https://www.codeforlife.education/login/student/) as a student 

3. Go to [www.codeforlife.education/play/kurono/dashboard](https://www.codeforlife.education/play/kurono/dashboard)

Here, you will be able to access the game your teacher has activated, which will be displayed in a large banner. *[Fig 2]*

**Code area**
* This is where the players will write their code to control their avatar. Once players have made a change to their code, they should
press the “Run code” button.
* After a few seconds, a notification will appear in the map view to show that their avatar is now running the updated code.
* The console log will display the output of any print statement as well as error messages
* Players can add print statements to help them
debug their code.

rightColumn.rightColumn:
**Map area**
* Here you will see the player's avatar on the map. The blue pointer above it will help distinguish their avatar from others.
* There is a compass in the bottom left of the map view to help players understand the orientation of the game map, so that the correct direction instructions can be given.
* There is a find me button in the bottom right corner for the player to click should they wish to recentre their avatar.
* The code written in the code view will be reflected in the avatar’s actions in the map view.
